maml:description.maml:para: Gets the object of a specific fog host

Searches a new or existing object of hosts for a specific host (or hosts) with search options of uuid, hostname, or mac address if no search terms are specified then it gets the search terms from your host that is making the request and tries to find your computer in fog

maml:Description.maml:para: the uuid of the host
the hostname of the host
a mac address linked to the host
defaults to calling Get-FogHosts but if you already have that in an object you can pass it here to speed up processing
the uuid of the host
the hostname of the host
a mac address linked to the host
defaults to calling Get-FogHosts but if you already have that in an object you can pass it here to speed up processing

command:example.dev:code: Get-FogHost -hostName MewoMachine

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: a cmdlet function for making fogAPI calls via powershell

Takes a few parameters with some pulled from settings.json and others are put in from the wrapper cmdlets Makes a call to the api of a fog server and returns the results of the call The returned value is an object that can then be easily filtered, processed, and otherwise manipulated in poweshell. The defaults for each setting explain how to find or a description of the property needed. fogApiToken = "fog API token found at https://fog-server/fog/management/index.php?node=about&sub=settings under API System"; fogUserToken = "your fog user api token found in the user settings https://fog-server/fog/management/index.php?node=user&sub=list select your api enabled used and view the api tab"; fogServer = "your fog server hostname or ip address to be used for created the url used in api calls default is fog-server or fogServer";

maml:Description.maml:para: Put in the path of the apicall that would follow http://fog-server/fog/ i.e. 'host/1234' would access the host with an id of 1234 This is filled by the wrapper commands using parameter validation to help ensure using the proper object names for the url
Defaults to 'Get' can also be Post, put, or delete, this param is handled better by the wrapper functions get is Get-fogObject post is New-fogObject delete is Remove-fogObject put is Update-fogObject
The jsondata string for including data in the body of a request

Put in the path of the apicall that would follow http://fog-server/fog/ i.e. 'host/1234' would access the host with an id of 1234 This is filled by the wrapper commands using parameter validation to help ensure using the proper object names for the url
Defaults to 'Get' can also be Post, put, or delete, this param is handled better by the wrapper functions get is Get-fogObject post is New-fogObject delete is Remove-fogObject put is Update-fogObject
The jsondata string for including data in the body of a request

maml:alert.maml:para: The online version of this help takes you to the fog project api help page

command:example.dev:code: Remove-UsbMacs -fogServer "foggy" -usbMacs @("01:23:45:67:89:10", "00:00:00:00:00:00")

maml:description.maml:para: Set fog server settings

Set the apitokens and server settings for api calls with this module the settings are stored in a json file in the current users roaming appdata ($ENV:APPDATA\FogApi) this is to keep it locked down and inaccessible to standard users and keeps the settings from being overwritten when updating the module

maml:Description.maml:para: fog API token found at https://fog-server/fog/management/index.php?node=about&sub=settings under API System
your fog user api token found in the user settings https://fog-server/fog/management/index.php?node=user&sub=list select your api enabled used and view the api tab
your fog server hostname or ip address to be used for created the url used in api calls default is fog-server or fogServer
switch to make setting these an interactive process

your fog server hostname or ip address to be used for created the url used in api calls default is fog-server or fogServer
switch to make setting these an interactive process

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-FogSnapins -hostid (Get-FogHost).id -pkgList @('Office365','chrome','slack')

maml:alert.maml:para: just saw this and just today was finding some issue with Update-fogobject The issue appears to be with the dynamic parameter variable I have in the function for the coreobjecttype. For some reason it is working when you call the function and brings up all the coreobject type choices but then the variable is being set to null when the function is running. Meaning that when function builds the uri it only gets http://fogserver/fog//id/edit instead of http://fogserver/fog/coreObjectType/id/edit

So one workaround I will try to publish by the end of the day is adding an optional uri parameter to that function so that you can manually override it when neccesarry. Also I should really add more documentation to each of the functions instead of just having it all under Invoke-fogapi
I also will add a try/catch block to invoke-fogapi for when invoke-restmethod fails and have it try invoke-webrequest.
